bug.author: filipecosta90
bug.description: <denchmark-code>23736:M 20 Feb 2020 01:33:30.651 # Redis is now ready to exit, bye bye... ==23736== ==23736== HEAP SUMMARY: ==23736== in use at exit: 10,966,091 bytes in 212,513 blocks ==23736== total heap usage: 633,781 allocs, 421,268 frees, 51,604,154 bytes allocated ==23736== ==23736== 4 bytes in 1 blocks are definitely lost in loss record 42 of 125,128 ==23736== at 0x4C2FB0F: malloc (in /usr/lib/valgrind/vgpreload_memcheck-amd64-linux.so) ==23736== by 0x144D38: zmalloc (zmalloc.c:99) ==23736== by 0x144F83: zstrdup (zmalloc.c:210) ==23736== by 0x1C7006: RM_Strdup (module.c:352) ==23736== by 0x16EF2140: RAI_ModelCreateTF (tensorflow.c:312) ==23736== by 0x67E69A7: RAI_ModelCreate (model.c:195) ==23736== by 0x67D784B: RedisAI_ModelSet_RedisCommand (redisai.c:620) ==23736== by 0x1C76BE: RedisModuleCommandDispatcher (module.c:575) ==23736== by 0x13D315: call (server.c:2468) ==23736== by 0x13DFCA: processCommand (server.c:2763) ==23736== by 0x14F086: processInputBuffer (networking.c:1470) ==23736== by 0x14F1DB: processInputBufferAndReplicate (networking.c:1505) ==23736== ==23736== LEAK SUMMARY: ==23736== definitely lost: 4 bytes in 1 blocks ==23736== indirectly lost: 0 bytes in 0 blocks ==23736== possibly lost: 124,286 bytes in 1,457 blocks ==23736== still reachable: 2,852,301 bytes in 65,302 blocks ==23736== of which reachable via heuristic: ==23736== stdstring : 2,230,937 bytes in 56,721 blocks ==23736== newarray : 3,424 bytes in 4 blocks ==23736== suppressed: 7,989,500 bytes in 145,753 blocks ==23736== Reachable blocks (those to which a pointer was found) are not shown. ==23736== To see them, rerun with: --leak-check=full --show-leak-kinds=all ==23736== ==23736== For counts of detected and suppressed errors, rerun with: -v ==23736== ERROR SUMMARY: 1 errors from 1 contexts (suppressed: 1 from 1) bad exit code for serverId 1 Redis did not exit cleanly basic_tests:test_example_multiproc </denchmark-code>
